triples.name: Retrieval-augmented generation
triples.relevance: The paper proposes neural-retrieval-in-the-loop architectures that use retrieval augmentation to reduce hallucination in conversational models.

triples.name: Hallucination (artificial intelligence)
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the problem of knowledge hallucination in dialogue models by proposing methods to reduce factual incorrectness.

triples.name: Dialogue system
triples.relevance: The paper tackles knowledge-grounded dialogue, a task requiring conversationally coherent responses with factual grounding.

triples.name: Question answering
triples.relevance: The paper builds on neural-retrieval-in-the-loop approaches from open-domain question answering to improve dialogue systems.

triples.name: Information retrieval
triples.relevance: The paper uses information retrieval components as core parts of its neural-retrieval-in-the-loop architecture.

triples.name: Learning to rank
triples.relevance: The paper employs ranker components to rank retrieved documents and context in the dialogue system.

triples.name: Autoencoder
triples.relevance: The paper uses encoder-decoder architectures as fundamental components in its conversational models.

triples.name: Chatbot
triples.relevance: The paper addresses hallucination problems in state-of-the-art dialogue models and chatbots for conversational applications.

triples.name: Fact-checking
triples.relevance: The paper aims to improve factual correctness in dialogue models, relating to the broader goal of fact-checking and verification.
